results.title: Mavis goes to Timor
results.creator_credit: Catherine Marciniak, Steve Westh, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
86 year old Mavis Taylor travels from Yarrawonga to East Timor on her first trip overseas. Against the odds, she plans to establish a sewing co-operative for the local women. Frustrated by bureaucracy, Mavis seeks assistance from the local community to help her transform an abandoned hospital into a warehouse and training centre for the co-operative. Her determination and perseverance is rewarded when the first order arrives and a group of local women are trained and organised to meet the delivery deadline. The project provides an opportunity for the women to establish economic security and independence for themselves and their community. During her stay in East Timor, Mavis also visits a church whose congregation was massacred by the Indonesian militia. Cinematography by Catherine Marciniak. Edited by Andrea Lang. Narrated by Anne Phelan.

results.title: Daria
results.creator_credit: Susie Lewis, MTV and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: The unlikely heroine of this offbeat animated MTV series is a cynical and quick witted teenage outsider named Daria Morgendorffer. Her cutting barbs are of course a way of coping with her vacuous teenage sister, her indifferent parents and the cliquey high school she attends which would be complete hell if it wasn’t for her like minded best friend, Jane.

results.title: Colour of war
results.creator_credit: Alastair Laurence, Lucy Carter, Carlton Television and Transworld International
results.brief_description: Almost all our recollections of the Second World War are in black and white. But years of research have unearthed hours of previously unseen colour film offering a completely new portrait of the war. The result is ‘Colour Of War’ a remarkable insight into the event that has shaped our modern world. Dramatic colour footage from as early as 1933 shows home movies of Adolf Hitler and his co-horts, the devastation wrought by the Blitz, life on the home front, D-Day and the Allied Invasion of France, British bombers defying German fighters, the horror of the Holocaust that greeted troops as they entered Germany and the jubilation of VE Day. With John Thaw’s narration and spoken accounts from the letters and diaries of those who fought, those who survived, and those the war claimed as victims, this three part documentary is an extraordinary remembrance.

group_works.title: Colour of war [DVD]
group_works.creator_credit: Alastair Laurence, Lucy Carter, Carlton Television and Transworld International

results.title: Colour of war [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alastair Laurence, Lucy Carter, Carlton Television and Transworld International
results.brief_description:
Almost all our recollections of the Second World War are in black and white. But years of research have unearthed hours of previously unseen colour film offering a completely new portrait of the war. The result is ‘Colour Of War’ a remarkable insight into the event that has shaped our modern world. Dramatic colour footage from as early as 1933 shows home movies of Adolf Hitler and his co-horts, the devastation wrought by the Blitz, life on the home front, D-Day and the Allied Invasion of France, British bombers defying German fighters, the horror of the Holocaust that greeted troops as they entered Germany and the jubilation of VE Day. With John Thaw’s narration and spoken accounts from the letters and diaries of those who fought, those who survived, and those the war claimed as victims, this three part documentary is an extraordinary remembrance.
1. ‘A new world order’ Reccollections of those involved during the pre-war turmoil of 1930s when the rhetoric of ideology and extremism was increasingly being heard. Highlights include combat footage of the Spanish Civil War, the coronation of King George VI in 1937, spectacular mass rallies in Germany and the Soviet Union and the images of the devastation of the Blitz in Great Britain.
2. ‘Total War’ Focuses on the period when the war reached a new, global intensity, beginning with the bombing of Pearl Harbor in December 1941 and ending in the Summer of 1944 with US Marines fighting bloody battles with the Japanese in the Pacific.
3. ‘Triumph and despair’ The experiences of British, American and Canadian soldiers, who made the historic crossing of the Channel, and who fought through The Battle of the Hedgerows to liberate Northern France, are heard through their letters and diaries. The fears and emotions expressed by American, French and Japanese soldiers and Japanese and German civilians are accompanied by footage of the fall of Berlin, the Battle of Okinawa, Kamikaze attacks and the devastation of the Atom bomb. This volume concludes with footage of the release of POWs, refugees and displaced people and reflects on the legacy of a war which cost 50 million lives.

Also available on VHS [313552], [313553], and [313554].

results.title: Jazz
results.creator_credit: Ken Burns, BBC, Florentine Films and WETA-TV
results.brief_description: JAZZ is a comprehensive 4 volume series directed by Ken Burns that presents a detailed history of the musical form from its beginnings in the early 19th Century to its development up to the present day. Researched and produced over a six year period it is a thorough and broad study of the history of Jazz and its musicians and includes musicians’ biographies, renowned and rare recordings, footage of live performances, interviews with artists, historians, writers and critics and rare film clips and still photographs that form an extraordinary mix of interpretations of and insight into the characters, origins, development, techniques and reshaping of the diverse musical form that is Jazz.

results.title: The Problem with men
results.creator_credit: Bruce Permezel, Denise Eriksen and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Presented by Bryan Dawe and John Clarke, this 4 part series looks at the area of men’s health - self examination, prevention of major illness such as heart disease and cancer, changing attitudes and bringing delicate areas specific to men’s health, into the limelight.

results.title: The Boys' own choice
results.creator_credit: Bruce Permezel, Denise Eriksen and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Problem with men”.
This episode in the “Problem with men” series traces the movement to increase awareness of men’s health. In Daylesford, Victoria, we witness a successful men’s health night presented by GPS’s, chemists and dignitaries. Meanwhile, in Dallas, Texas, we visit the first Male Health Centre - the layout of the building, the clientele they attract. The centre is also involved in the regular, on-site health screenings for all male American Airlines employees, a process which has proved very successful in identifying major illnesses such as cancer. Presented by John Clarke and Bryan Dawe.

results.title: The Thing from the black lagoon
results.creator_credit: Bruce Permezel, Denise Eriksen, ABC-TV (Australia) and Beyond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Problem with men”.
Prostate cancer is a disease that affects thousands of men world-wide. Men with a family history of prostate cancer, those over 50, and men showing symptoms should all be screened. We follow a patient having his prostate removed following cancer detection through PSA level testing. Norman Schwarzkopf and Professor Derek Llewellyn-Jones also discuss their experience with the disease - particularly the course of treatment they chose, side effects and how they’ve coped since then. Presented by John Clarke and Bryan Dawe.

results.title: The John Thomas show
results.creator_credit: Bruce Permezel, Denise Eriksen, ABC-TV (Australia) and Beyond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Problem with men”.
Bryan Dawe and John Clarke introduce the delicate areas of impotence and testicular cancer. Testicular cancer can be treated early if picked up through self examination - if left, removal is the only option. Men who have had a testicle removed discuss if, and how the surgery and treatment has affected their lives. They also postulate on why self examination does not receive the same coverage that women’s self examination does. Meanwhile, impotence sufferers and their partners describe their experiences and medical professionals go through the pros and cons of vacuum pumps, self injection and where impotence treatment is heading. We are also shown how to examine for testicular abnormalities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Permezel, Denise Eriksen, ABC-TV (Australia) and Beyond Productions

results.title: The Life cycle of the ostrich
results.creator_credit: Bruce Permezel, Denise Eriksen, ABC-TV (Australia) and Beyond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Problem with men”.
This introductory episode in “The Problem with men” looks at why males die younger than females. It attempts to find answers in youth (we follow the goings on at a B & S Ball in Derrinallum), how men live life more dangerously, what behaviour means about the nature of being a man, and how it impacts on health. It looks at what happens to men - health wise - in the under 10’s, 20’s and 40’s age brackets, as well as outlining what’s involved in a check up. Presented by John Clarke and Bryan Dawe.
